Posted By: MasterOfEtherium (4/18/2012 6:58:35 PM)

@Izzy187
There is nothing in the wording of Rooftop Storm that necessitates casting from your hand. It is indeed very plausible to cast and recast Gravecrawler from the graveyard for free as many times as you like to make Grimgrin, Corpse-Born infinitely powerful.

As for the card itself, although it being a brand new rare makes it difficult to get my hands on, I'm getting two today and finding two more in the near future for my B/U Zombie deck. Fantastic zombie, makes Diregraf Ghoul look very mediocre in comparison. 5/5.

posts.post_content:
(This plus Grimgrin, Corpse-Born and Rooftop Storm = infinite counters on Grimgrin.) @SwordOfKaldra   
  
Thats a lie, because casting something has to be from YOUR HAND, gravecrawler has a ability which allows you to pay 1 mana to bring him back. You can however use Geralf's messengers and fume spitters. Because sac-ing a fume spitter puts a -1/-1 on any creature, so you can have crazy messengers with undying all the time.

posts.post_content:
[Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler) [Noxious Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noxious Ghoul) [Corpse Harvester](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpse Harvester) [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact) [Undead Warcheif](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Warcheif)  
  
in combination, these cards are devastating. Most directly, [Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler)'s built in recursion lets me toss him to [Corpse Harvester](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpse Harvester), then bring him back, trigering [Noxious Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noxious Ghoul)'s effect to wipe creatures, along with setting off [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact), and with even 1 [Undead Warcheif](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Warcheif), he hits for 4 each time. A key element is that the previous card I used for this, [Festering Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Festering Goblin) would cost me (typically) my [Lord of the Undead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Undead)'s tap ability to recour. With that freed up, I can bring back other cards.  
  
Unable to block, there is no reason not to swing with him so long as 1 remains in play on my side of the field. Though I have to refrain from [Vengeful Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeful Dead) ,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Gravecrawler Noxious Ghoul Corpse Harvester Grave Pact Undead Warcheif

in combination, these cards are devastating. Most directly, Gravecrawler's built in recursion lets me toss him to Corpse Harvester, then bring him back, trigering Noxious Ghoul's effect to wipe creatures, along with setting off Grave Pact, and with even 1 Undead Warcheif, he hits for 4 each time. A key element is that the previous card I used for this, Festering Goblin would cost me (typically) my Lord of the Undead's tap ability to recour. With that freed up, I can bring back other cards.

Unable to block, there is no reason not to swing with him so long as 1 remains in play on my side of the field. Though I have to refrain from Vengeful Dead ,... (see all)
